reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this hotel!!! We loved the location, it's literally a few steps from the Spanish Steps. The rooms are spotless, beds are extremely comfortable and completely soundproofed. The staff is equal to that in a five star hotel.
reviews.title: Look No Further, this is THE Place to Stay When in Rome!

reviews.text: We're stopping in Rome for a few nights at the end of a trip we're taking this June and I'm so sad this property is already booked. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: great rome hotel

reviews.text: If you're looking for a luxury boutique hotel that's spotlessly clean with exemplary service, look no further!
reviews.title: Wonderful, attentive, and brillant location!

reviews.text: Portrait Suites is really a great property. The service is top notch - all of the staff are incredibly welcoming and helpful, and they really make you feel at home. The room (number 53) was thoughtfully laid out and nicely decorated, with lots of storage space and a little kitchenette and table, large bathroom with a deep tub and really nice shower. TV (large flat screen) is nice, and although channels are limited, the DVD player in the room helped - just bought a bunch of Italian films with English subtitles to watch in the room. The room also had a nice balcony overlooking Via Condotti. The rooftop terrace (with cozy fireplace!) is spectacular, with views of the Spanish Steps and much of Rome.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel in Excellent Location

likes.disliked: — not a full service hotel but quite close to it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one drawback at Portrait Suites is that save for the continental breakfast (which is just okay), there is no room service. Generally not a problem in Rome where great food is ample, but occasionally missed. Even thought it is a small hotel, it would be great if they could make an arrangement with another nearby hotel or a restaurant to deliver to guests.
reviews.title: a great location

reviews.text: 1. Location - Since we were only spending a few nights in Rome it was the location of the hotel that sealed the deal. Its right smack on Via Condoti and walking distance to almost all the sites.

reviews.text: 2. Service - This is what makes the hotel very very special. Service was very genuine and effortless.
reviews.title: Fantastic Portrait Suites, best hotel in Rome?
Loved the Portrait Suites
reviews.text: 3. Design- Contemporary yet it did not feel cold, maybe it was because of the service. The room was spacious , the roof top was excellent and the honesty bar was the best way to relax and take in the view of the spanish steps after walking all day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my boyfriend stumbled upon the portrait suites while we were shopping on via condotti and we went in to check it out and was immediately blown away. (we were staying at la posta vecchia in lazio which is another great hotel but that's another story) anyway, we decided to move there and had a truly great experience. the staff are all so friendly and helpful and the roof top garden is exceptional. the property is superbly furnished and really feels like home away from home. the location is superb needless to say...the best among the lugarno hotels
reviews.title: Italiance elegance at its best

likes.disliked: — Soundproofing of the rooms left to be desired

reviews.title: Best hotel in Rome period.
reviews.text: If you're hesitating between portrait suites and another hotel- quit wasting your time and book portrait now! You won't regret it. Awesome suites that make you feel at home, service that takes care of your every need, and a location to die for- this hotel has it all. Booked it for a romantic weekend with the missus and let's just say I knocked this one out of the park. Just be careful they only have 14 rooms so they sell out quick. Book it now!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on a short break to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday and we could not have asked for a more relaxing and enjoyable stay. The location is superb in the heart of the shopping district and our first afternoon was spent relaxing in the heat on the roof terrace sipping perfectly mixed cosmopolitans looking across the rooftops at the Spanish steps. We took all of our breakfasts on the roof terrace as well and it felt as if we had the place to ourselves. Our room was well proportioned and extremely comfortable and the staff were excellent recommending some hidden gems of restaurants (bear in mind it does not have one itself). Whether I would recommend this hotel for a long stay I am not sure but for a short break in an amazing location with a perfect roof terrace to sip champagne and relax after a days shopping I certainly would. If you do go try to coincide your stay with an event at the Terme di Caracalla - what an amazing venue!
reviews.title: Sipping cocktails on the roof terrace looking at the Spanish steps with the one you love!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a private little gem in the heart of the shopping district at the bottom of the Spanish Steps. The hotel is a collection of 14 rooms located above the Feragamo store. The suites are finely appointed with tables resembling suitcases and photos of shoes throughout. The suites have remarkable built in kitchenettes including small dishwashers and cooktops so you could cook your own dinner en suite. The bathroom is a little small, with little space for a wash kit, but an amazing collection of shampoos and lotions are provided. Turn down service is complete with a bottle of water and slippers laid out for you. Continental breakfast is included and is lovely with an assortment of rolls (including chocolate croissants!) and breads, warm milk and cappacino and delicious musseli.
reviews.title: secret gem in heart of shopping district

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All staff were polite and incredibly helpful. Ask and they will accomodate. There is a lovely rooftop lounge with fireplace and honor bar and fantastic views of Rome.
reviews.title: Location location

reviews.text: The only thing this hotel lacks is a central lobby, though the rooftop helps make up for this.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location and Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is located in an upscale, walking-only shopping district of Rome, near such stores as Ferragamo and Gucci. (Sadly, no Spencer Gifts)
reviews.title: Nice Boutique in Upscale Area
This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in, if not the best!
reviews.text: The room was small, but very nice. Flat paneled TV, free wifi, nice bedding, comfortable beds, new bathrooms. No views to be had out of my window. After my first night there, the cleaning room apparently used some sort of toxic, nostril-burning cleaner on one of my countertops, which prompted them to move me to a suite at no extra charge. Not a huge hassle and they looked as if they were about to tell me they found a dead body in my room when they approached me with the news upon my return to the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As advertised, the 7th floor rooftop garden is one of the nicest features of the hotel. Guests receive complimentary access until midnight. It gives splendid nighttime views of the area and the Spanish Steps. They stock a pantry on the roof each night with plenty of drinks, mixers, snacks, lemons, ice, etc for guests to serve themselves in exchange for IOU slips. Very cool, utilized and unusually trusting.
reviews.title: Perfect for Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Concierge service was extremely helpful and efficient -- offering to hook up a private tour of the Vatican for an hourly fee. Breakfast is included -- though they charge for anything cooked or heated -- like eggs.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, best service in town
